data.title: Friday’s high school tournament scores and highlights
data.meta_description: ROUNDUPBOYS BASKETBALLMason Medeiros (16 points, five rebounds) and Dom Taylor (15 points, six rebounds) reached double figures in the scorebook, while Max Finlaw (nine points, seven rebounds), Brendan McDonald (nine points) and Finn Bjork (six points, 13 rebounds) put on good performances as well for fourth-seeded Somerset Berkley (21-2) in a 55-41 Div. 2 quarterfinal […]
data.text:
ROUNDUP

BOYS BASKETBALL

Mason Medeiros (16 points, five rebounds) and Dom Taylor (15 points, six rebounds) reached double figures in the scorebook, while Max Finlaw (nine points, seven rebounds), Brendan McDonald (nine points) and Finn Bjork (six points, 13 rebounds) put on good performances as well for fourth-seeded Somerset Berkley (21-2) in a 55-41 Div. 2 quarterfinal win over No. 5 Mansfield. … Behind Drexler Pierre’s 11-point, 11-rebound double-double and a team-high 16 points from Matt Gaffney, two-time defending state champion No. 1 Malden Catholic (14-9) clinched another trip to the Final Four with a 60-43 win over No. 8 Holyoke. … Jameson Baer scored 15 points for No. 14 Bedford (19-3) in a 69-43 win over No. 38 Middleboro.

Seniors again showed out for fifth-seeded Xaverian (17-6) to get to the Div. 1 state semifinals with a 55-52 win over No. 4 North Andover. Lorenzo Carrara scored 19 points, JJ Honekamp added 17 points and Roman Perdoni did a little of everything with eight points, four rebounds and four assists for the Hawks who won three games in the tournament for the first time since 1990.

Mike Dankert netted his 1,000th career point during a 19-point display, while Leo Andrade and Dom Quelle notched 18 points each and Nate Reynolds finished with 12 points as second-seeded Bourne (22-1) coasted to the Div. 4 state semifinals with a 71-46 win over No. 10 David Prouty.

GIRLS BASKETBALL

Shooting 10-for-13 from the field, Julia Webster (22 points, 12 rebounds) combined with big efforts from Maddy Steel (20 points on six 3-pointers) and Lily Singer (10 points, six rebounds) to guide top-seeded Bishop Feehan (19-4) to a 75-26 rout of No. 8 Lexington in Div. 1 state quarterfinal play. Charlotte Adams-Lopez dished 10 assists and quality team defense allowed just two points in the second and third quarters.

Izzy Kittredge (15 points, eight rebounds), Naya Annigeri (13 points) and Sadie Cummings (nine points) paced No. 1 Medfield (21-2) in a 57-44 Div. 2 quarterfinal win over No. 9 Norwood.

Jillian Roberts buried 18 points, while Juliana Conte and AJ Hyacinthe recorded nine points apiece to steer No. 5 St. Mary’s (Lynn) (20-6) toward the Div. 3 state semifinals with a 47-31 victory over No. 4 Hanover. Reese Matela put in a strong all-around performance for the Spartans with eight points, eight rebounds and four blocks. … Reagan Dowd scored 21 points and grabbed five rebounds, while Maddie Oliver (11 points, 13 rebounds, eight assists) and Alex Cassidy (11 points, 11 rebounds) had double-doubles as No. 2 Norwell (22-1) bested No. 7 Sandwich, 62-40.

Maddie Pitro scored a game-high 22 points, leading second-seeded West Boylston (20-3) to a 63-43 win over No. 7 Maynard in a Div. 5 state quarterfinal.
